column4: HI , i am trying to make a server use static IP, i have edited the interface file and added the auto eth0
iface eth0 inet static  lines,   now when i try to  restart the networking, it says RTNETLINK answers: File exists
can you pastebin the lines you have added (or retype in a pastebin).
you also set the network address as the same as the default gateway
can u tell me the difference between network and gateway ips int eh interface file, sorry I am newbie
the gateway is the node your system will send data to if the address is not in your system's subnet. The network IP is the address of the entire network.

so your netmask gives 253 networks, the network address will be .0 and the broadcast IP is .255   the network section of the address is 192.168.1   and anything not in that subnet will be sent to the default gateway to be sent out to the WAN
you can use a more restrictive netwmask like 255.255.255.248 this will mean the network addresses will be 192.168.0.0, 192.168.0.0, 8, 192.168.0.0, 16, 192.168.0.0, 24   and so on
all I did was copy the error which YOU pasted and slung it in duckduckgo, seems to happen a bit.
can you give the output of:   sudo apt-get install pastebinit; clear; pastebinit /etc/lsb-release     Thanks
